content.question:
Step 1: 

<math alttext="N 2 O 5 produces N O 2 plus N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 
(slow) 

Step 2: 

<math alttext="N O 2 plus N O 3 produces N O 2 plus N O plus O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 
(fast) 

Step 3: 

<math alttext="N O plus N 2 O 5 produces 3 N O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 
(fast) 

A proposed reaction mechanism for the decomposition of <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is shown above. Based on the proposed mechanism, which of the following correctly identifies both the chemical equation and the rate law for the overall reaction?

choices.label: The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="N O gas plus N 2 O 5 gas produces 3 N O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O, times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 N 2 O 5 gas produces 4 N O 2 gas plus O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 N 2 O 5 gas produces 4 N O 2 gas plus O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="N 2 O 5 gas plus N O gas plus N O 3 gas produces 4 N O 2 gas plus O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5, times the molar concentration of N O, times the molar concentration of N O 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[NO</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 N 2 O 5 gas produces 4 N O 2 gas plus O 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
